result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke P Wojtalewicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).
  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with Portage County Case # 13CF344.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders deductions for costs from defendant's earnings and accounts at the rate of 25%.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not go upon the premises of any bars, taverns or businesses whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis, no surcharge assessed.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Defendant must purchase all prescriptions from same pharmacy.
New prescriptions to be reported within 72 hours to Agent.
